stock

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • stock.Stock

  • public class Stock
extends java.lang.Object
    The Stock class represents a collection of Item objects. It uses a HashMap as a data structure to contain the amounts of each Item. The HashMap is of type Map<Item, Integer>.
    Author:
    alfhj

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) java.util.Map<stock.Item,java.lang.Integer> items

      Constructs an empty Stock and initializes the HashMap.

    • Method Detail

      • getItems

        public java.util.Map<stock.Item,java.lang.Integer> getItems()
        Returns an unmodifiable version of the Map representing the items. It is unmodifiable so that the contents will not be overwritten by direct access to the map (put, remove, replace).
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable Map<Item, Integer>

      • addItems

        public void addItems(stock.Item item,
                     int amount)
              throws stock.StockException
        Adds the specified item to the stock so that the amount is updated.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be added
        amount - the amount of items to be added, must be 0 or greater
        Throws:
        stock.StockException - if amount is negative

      • removeItems

        public void removeItems(stock.Item item,
                        int amount)
                 throws stock.StockException
        Removes the specified item from the stock so that the amount updated.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be removed
        amount - the amount of items to be removed, must be 0 or greater
        Throws:
        stock.StockException - if the item is not found in the stock, if the amount is negative, or if the updated amount is negative

      • searchItem

        public java.util.Map.Entry<stock.Item,java.lang.Integer> searchItem(java.lang.String str)
                                                             throws stock.StockException
        Searches for an item in the stock by an item's name.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to be search representing the item's name
        Returns:
        the Entry<Item, Integer> for the searched item
        Throws:
        stock.StockException - if the item is not found

      • getNumItems

        public int getNumItems()
        Returns the total number of items in the stock
        Returns:
        total item amount
